description: After days of unrest and self-doubt, Sven Halek decides to trigger the release of the BCI abuse archive, believing the public deserves the full truth.

Oksana Lintz, under mounting pressure and with Sven's approval, publicly releases the full BCI abuse archive. Stenograd reels as details of systemic injustice, wrongful denials, and flawed scoring histories become impossible to ignore.
Vigils, protests, and open forums spread across the city. Survivors, families, and advocates demand apologies, reparations, and accountability from city leaders.
Community assemblies initiate truth commissions, directly confronting Council members and demanding restorative justice for BCI victims.
The Council, divided by public outrage, is forced to abolish centralized behavioral scoring. New frameworks for oversight and remembrance of past abuse victims are announced.
